post_text:
The Putnam County Courthouse and the License Bureau will be closed September 7th, 2020, in observance of Labor Day.

The FOLLOWING PUTNAM COUNTY COURTHOUSE OFFICES will be CLOSING at 12:00 p.m. September 8th - 11th, 2020 for the Putnam County Fair.

COUNTY CLERK'S OFFICE

TREASURER'S OFFICE

ASSESSOR'S OFFICE

RECORDER'S OFFICE

*The License Bureau will be closed all day Thursday, September 10th and Friday, September 11th, 2020.*

*The Circuit Clerks/Courts Office will be open regular office hours 8 a.m. - 12 p.m. & 1 p.m. - 5 p.m.*

We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause.

post_text:
JOB OPENING

The Putnam County Clerks office is accepting applications for the following position: Secretary. A brief summary of the job duties are as follows but not limited to:

Answering phones, general filing, general reports for the office, assisting the deputy clerk where needed, must be self-motivated, must be able to work well with the public, possess excellent computer skills, be well organized and able to work fluently with the other offices in the courthouse. Must be able to lift at least 50lbs. (Election equipment) Must be able to identify and maintain confidential information.

Applications may be obtained in the County Clerk’s Office at 1601 Main Street, Room 101, during business hours 8:30 am-12 pm and 1 pm-4:30 pm. We will be accepting applications until January 29, 2020. Please keep in mind the county does NOT offer health insurance benefits. If you have applied within the past six months and would like your application reviewed please feel free to contact our office at 660-947-2674 or 2694. Putnam County Courthouse is an EOE.

shared_text:
Putnam County R-1 Schools
August 31, 2018 at 10:00 AM ·

Every school day, our teachers, staff, and administration are entrusted to provide a safe and healthy learning environment for each one of our students. Back to School is always a good time to refresh students and staff on safety precautions and procedures. You probably remember practicing earthquake, fire and tornado drills when you were a student.

🛎️Today we will be conducting two safety drills. First, we will have an earthquake drill sometime before lunch.

🛎️The last safety drill will take place this afternoon. We will be conducting a full evacuation drill. What does this mean?
In collaboration with local law enforcement, emergency responders, and other public agencies, we will safely evacuate all students and staff to our rally point. Once all the students and staff have arrived, we will all return to the school to finish the school day.

🛎️Again this is just a drill.

Thank you for your support in helping us keep our schools safe.

Putnam County R-1 Schools
August 31, 2018 at 10:00 AM ·

Every school day, our teachers, staff, and administration are entrusted to provide a safe and healthy learning environment for each one of our students. Back to School is always a good time to refresh students and staff on safety precautions and procedures. You probably remember practicing earthquake, fire and tornado drills when you were a student.

🛎️Today we will be conducting two safety drills. First, we will have an earthquake drill sometime before lunch.

🛎️The last safety drill will take place this afternoon. We will be conducting a full evacuation drill. What does this mean?
In collaboration with local law enforcement, emergency responders, and other public agencies, we will safely evacuate all students and staff to our rally point. Once all the students and staff have arrived, we will all return to the school to finish the school day.

🛎️Again this is just a drill.

Thank you for your support in helping us keep our schools safe.

post_text: Missouri’s photo ID law is in effect! When you go to the polls on Tuesday, April 3, 2018 please remember to take your PHOTO ID! Show a government issued photo ID such as Driver License, Non-driver license, Passport , Military ID. If you do not have a government issued photo ID you can still vote. Present your Voter Identification Card or another acceptable form of ID and you will be required to sign a Voter Statement and you will be able to vote. Please share this post and remember to VOTE🇺🇸🇺🇸🇺🇸
text: Missouri’s photo ID law is in effect! When you go to the polls on Tuesday, April 3, 2018 please remember to take your PHOTO ID! Show a government issued photo ID such as Driver License, Non-driver license, Passport , Military ID. If you do not have a government issued photo ID you can still vote. Present your Voter Identification Card or another acceptable form of ID and you will be required to sign a Voter Statement and you will be able to vote. Please share this post and remember to VOTE🇺🇸🇺🇸🇺🇸

post_text:
Full Time Position
The County Clerk’s Office will be accepting applications for a Full Time Position until August 14th, 2017. Individual must be self-motivated, be computer knowledgeable, and must be able to maintain confidentiality as needed. Pay based on experience. Currently the County does NOT offer Health Insurance Benefits. Applications may be obtained in the County Clerk’s Office at the Courthouse located at 1601 Main Street, Room 101, Unionville, Mo 63565. Inquiries can be made about the position by calling 660-947-2674 or 2694.

post_text:
Issued today March 3, 2017

Due to extreme dry conditions and upon the suggestion of all of the Fire Chiefs in Putnam County, Missouri, the Putnam County Commission has declared a Burn Ban for all of Putnam County starting today March 3, 2017, until further notice. We thank you in advance for you cooperation.

Sincerely,

Putnam County Commission
Randy Sands, Presiding
Gerald Owings, Western Dist.
Shane Bradshaw, Eastern Dist.

post_text:
Road and Bridge Job Opening

The Putnam County Commission will be accepting applications for the Road and Bridge Crew until 4:30 p.m. February 24, 2017. Welding experience and the operation of heavy equipment experience is necessary, CDL license is a plus, pay will be based on skills and experience. If interested please pick up an application at the Courthouse in the Putnam County Clerk’s Office, 1601 Main Street, Room 101, Unionville, MO 63565

Putnam County is an Equal Opportunity Employer
text:
Road and Bridge Job Opening

The Putnam County Commission will be accepting applications for the Road and Bridge Crew until 4:30 p.m. February 24, 2017. Welding experience and the operation of heavy equipment experience is necessary, CDL license is a plus, pay will be based on skills and experience. If interested please pick up an application at the Courthouse in the Putnam County Clerk’s Office, 1601 Main Street, Room 101, Unionville, MO 63565

Putnam County is an Equal Opportunity Employer

post_text: Anna Watt sworn in as Coroner! Congrats on another term!
text: Anna Watt sworn in as Coroner! Congrats on another term!

post_text: Local elected officials sworn in today and will start/continue their positions as of January 1, 2017. Congrats to Gerald Owings, Western District Commissioner, Shane Bradshaw, Eastern District Commissioner, Ami Hartwig, Public Administrator, Jason Knight, Sheriff. The Collector/Treasurer will be sworn in The end of March. The Assessor the end of August. The coroner at a later date.
text: Local elected officials sworn in today and will start/continue their positions as of January 1, 2017. Congrats to Gerald Owings, Western District Commissioner, Shane Bradshaw, Eastern District Commissioner, Ami Hartwig, Public Administrator, Jason Knight, Sheriff. The Collector/Treasurer will be sworn in The end of March. The Assessor the end of August. The coroner at a later date.

post_text:
**NOTICE**

The FOLLOWING PUTNAM COUNTY COURTHOUSE OFFICES will be CLOSING at 12:00 PM September 6th, 7th, 8th, 9th, 2016 for the Putnam County Fair:

County Clerk’s Office
Treasurer’s Office
Assessor’s Office
Recorder’s Office

*The License Bureau will close at 12:00 pm on Thursday, Sept 8th, and All Friday, September 9th, 2016 ONLY!*

*The Circuit Court will be open regular office hours 8 am -12 pm & 1 pm -5 pm*

We apologize for inconvenience this may cause.

post_text:
NOTICE

****ALL Putnam County Courthouse Offices and the License Bureau will be closed Thursday, December 25 and 26, 2014 in observance of Christmas….

***All courthouse offices and the and LICENSE BUREAU will be closed on Thursday, January 1, 2015 in observance of the New Year…. The Putnam County Courthouse will also be closed on JANUARY 2, 2015 for the New Year Holiday…THE CIRCUIT COURT AND THE LICENSE BUREAU WILL REMAIN OPEN ON JANUARY 2, 2015 ****

************************************************************************

***The License Bureau WILL BE OPEN on December 31, 2014 to collect taxes
from 9am-12pm.***

***The PC Treasurer WILL BE OPEN on December 31, 2014 to collect taxes
from 9am-12pm and 1pm to 4:30 pm***

HAVE A MERRY CHRISTMAS
& HAPPY NEW YEAR!!
